intro: Xyris amorimii, commonly known as the Amorim's yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the genus Xyris, which is part of the family Xyridaceae, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in wetland environments and is adapted to moist, acidic soils. Xyris amorimii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
